column1: Industrial bronchitis is swelling (inflammation) of the large airways of the lungs that occurs in some people who work around certain dusts, fumes, smoke, or other substances.
Exposure to dusts, fumes, strong acids, and other chemicals in the air causes this type of bronchitis.
The health care provider will listen to your lungs using a stethoscope.
Call your health care provider if you are regularly exposed to dusts, fumes, strong acids, or other chemicals that can affect the lungs and you develop symptoms of bronchitis.
